guidelines: Use concise, professional language.
Avoid overly verbose or complex sentences.
Ensure the resume is easy to skim, with key points standing out.
Focus on measurable achievements using action verbs (e.g., 'Led,' 'Developed,' 'Implemented').
Avoid vague or generic statements like 'Hardworking team player.'
Ensure uniform formatting, including font, bullet style, and alignment.
Use consistent date formats (e.g., 'Jan 2020 – Dec 2021').
Maintain consistent tone and style throughout.
Avoid slang or informal language.
Use industry-appropriate terminology.
Humor is acceptable if it is professional and appropriate for the job type (e.g., '12++ years of experience' for software engineers).
Include name, professional email, phone number, and LinkedIn profile (optional: GitHub or portfolio link).
Do not include irrelevant personal details (e.g., marital status, age).
Ensure this section is at the top of the resume.
Use 2-4 sentences to summarize your career highlights, skills, and goals.
Avoid clichés and focus on unique value propositions.
List skills in categories (e.g., Programming Languages, Cloud Platforms, Tools).
Avoid generic skills like 'Microsoft Office' unless specifically relevant to the job.
Order skills by relevance to the job.
Start with the most recent position and list experiences in reverse chronological order.
For each role, include: job title, company name, location, and dates.
Highlight measurable achievements and responsibilities using 2-5 bullet points.
Use action verbs and quantify impact wherever possible (e.g., 'Increased system performance by 30% by optimizing database queries').
Include degree, institution, and graduation year (or expected graduation year).
Mention honors or relevant coursework if applicable.
If the degree is incomplete, focus on skills or knowledge gained.
List relevant certifications and training.
Include issuing organization and date of completion.
Include notable projects that demonstrate relevant skills.
Provide a brief description, focusing on outcomes and technologies used.
Include only if relevant to the job or demonstrates transferable skills.
Include if relevant to the job or showcase subject matter expertise.
Provide title, publication name, and date.
Keep the resume to 1-2 pages, depending on experience.
Use clear section headers and consistent spacing.
Avoid decorative fonts or colors—stick to professional designs.
Remove outdated or irrelevant roles (e.g., part-time jobs from 10 years ago).
Avoid repeating the same points across multiple sections.
Ensure every section is complete and includes necessary information (e.g., dates, achievements).
Avoid speculative or unsupported claims (e.g., 'Possesses strong leadership qualities' without evidence).
